net.mobid.codetraq.runnables
Class MessageTracker

java.lang.Object
  net.mobid.codetraq.runnables.MessageTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class MessageTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class tracks the message database and sends (or try to send) any message left in the database. The daemon will always try to delete a message after it succesfully being sent. You should set the Message Round (the number of minutes between sending message process) to a number that is suitable for your own circumstances.

Method Detail

setXMPPTalker

public void setXMPPTalker(ITalker value)
Sets an instance of XMPPTalker for this MessageTracker. XMPP is the protocol to use if you wish to send messages via Google Talk or Jabber.

Parameters:
value - - a XMPPTalker instance

setMSNTalker

public void setMSNTalker(ITalker value)
Sets an instance of MSNTalker for this MessageTracker. MSN is the protocol to use if you wish to send messages via MSN.

Parameters:
value - - a MSNTalker instance

setEmailTalker

public void setEmailTalker(ITalker value)
Sets an instance of EmailTalker for this MessageTracker. Use this if you wish to send messages via email.

Parameters:
value -

run

public void run()
Monitors the message database and tries to send any unsent messages. Messages will be deleted after successfully sent. If a message is unsent, it will be left in the database for another try in the next round.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
